title: Magic shortbow (i)

properties.value: The magic shortbow (i) is a bow that requires level 50 Ranged in order to use, and is obtained by using a magic shortbow scroll on a regular magic shortbow. The imbued bow has +75 Ranged attack, instead of the regular bow's +69, and uses 50% of the special bar when performing the special attack, instead of the regular bow's 55%.

The magic shortbow (i) is a bow that requires level 50 Ranged in order to use, and is obtained by using a magic shortbow scroll on a regular magic shortbow. The imbued bow has +75 Ranged attack, instead of the regular bow's +69, and uses 50% of the special bar when performing the special attack, instead of the regular bow's 55%.

Typically, a magic shortbow with rune arrows deals significantly higher damage-per-second than a rune crossbow with broad bolts.

Special attack[edit | edit source]

A player performing the magic shortbow's special attack, Snapshot.

This weapon retains the standard magic shortbow's special attack, Snapshot, which fires two arrows in rapid succession but with lowered accuracy, using 50% of the player's special attack energy. While the in-game tooltip states that Snapshot has reduced accuracy, it actually likely has an accuracy boost of 10 7 {\displaystyle {\frac {10}{7}}} or about 43%.[1]

Damage inflicted by Snapshot is unaffected by Ranged-boosting prayers (such as Eagle Eye and Rigour) and the Slayer helmet (i), but its accuracy is.[2][3]

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
9 October 2014
(update | poll)

Increases range bonus from +69 to +75.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 18 September 2018. (Archived from the original on 23 May 2021.) Mod Ash: "Looks to me like it's a 43% buff, not a nerf."
  2. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 29 August 2019. (Archived from the original on 23 May 2021.) Mod Ash: "They always had their own special calculations for effective accuracy/damage, and thus ignored things like Void Knight effects, as far as I know."
  3. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 23 May 2021. (Archived from the original on 23 May 2021.) Mod Ash: "Correct, it does now affect that spec, and every other custom attack I've seen so far."

[[File:Magic shortbow (i) detail.png|left|150x150px]]
The '''magic shortbow (i)''' is a bow that requires level 50 [[Ranged]] in order to use, and is obtained by using a [[magic shortbow scroll]] on a regular [[magic shortbow]]. The imbued bow has +75 Ranged attack, instead of the regular bow's +69, and uses 50% of the special bar when performing the special attack, instead of the regular bow's 55%.

Typically, a magic shortbow with [[rune arrows]] deals significantly higher damage-per-second than a [[rune crossbow]] with [[broad bolts]].

==Special attack==
[[File:Snapshot.gif|thumb|250px|A player performing the magic shortbow's special attack, ''Snapshot''.]]
This weapon retains the standard magic shortbow's [[special attack]], ''Snapshot'', which fires two arrows in rapid succession but with lowered accuracy, using 50% of the player's special attack energy. While the in-game tooltip states that ''Snapshot'' has reduced accuracy, it actually likely has an accuracy boost of <math>\frac{10}{7}</math> or about 43%.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1042029374428639232|date=18 September 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/drdmT|archivedate=23 May 2021|quote=Looks to me like it's a 43% buff, not a nerf.}} 

Damage inflicted by ''Snapshot'' is unaffected by [[Ranged]]-boosting prayers (such as [[Eagle Eye]] and [[Rigour]]) and the [[Slayer helmet (i)]], but its accuracy is.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1167133164642480131|date=29 August 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/N4QyN|archivedate=23 May 2021|quote=They always had their own special calculations for effective accuracy/damage, and thus ignored things like Void Knight effects, as far as I know.}}{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/jagexash/status/1396397301925662723|date=23 May 2021|archiveurl=https://archive.is/gl7hL|archivedate=23 May 2021|quote=Correct, it does now affect that spec, and every other custom attack I've seen so far.}}
